intro: Silene pomelii var. rosella, commonly known as the Rosella Catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in open, sunny habitats. Its leaves are linear and often covered with fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. Silene pomelii var. rosella is a short-lived perennial, often found in arid or semi-arid regions.
